channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11023] Port HBASE-10488 "'mvn site' is broken due to org.apache.jasper.JspC not found" to 0.98
item.description: This is to port the fix (mostly in hbase-thrift/pom.xml) for the site target.
item.summary: Port HBASE-10488 "'mvn site' is broken due to org.apache.jasper.JspC not found" to 0.98

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Straightforward port of Andy's patch.

Andrew Purtell:
Is it Okay to integrate this into 0.98 ?
See my comment on the original JIRA and the related Bigtop one.

Using this command under root of 0.98 workspace :


mvn clean install -DskipTests site assembly:single -Prelease

I got:


[INFO] Building tar: /homes/hortonzy/98/hbase-assembly/target/hbase-0.98.2-SNAPSHOT-bin.tar.gz

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Reactor Summary:

[INFO]

[INFO] HBase ............................................. SUCCESS [6:38.136s]

[INFO] HBase - Common .................................... SUCCESS [8.214s]

[INFO] HBase - Protocol .................................. SUCCESS [9.392s]

[INFO] HBase - Client .................................... SUCCESS [4.325s]

[INFO] HBase - Hadoop Compatibility ...................... SUCCESS [0.893s]

[INFO] HBase - Hadoop Two Compatibility .................. SUCCESS [1.590s]

[INFO] HBase - Prefix Tree ............................... SUCCESS [1.391s]

[INFO] HBase - Server .................................... SUCCESS [21.783s]

[INFO] HBase - Testing Util .............................. SUCCESS [0.450s]

[INFO] HBase - Thrift .................................... SUCCESS [5.768s]

[INFO] HBase - Shell ..................................... SUCCESS [0.732s]

[INFO] HBase - Integration Tests ......................... SUCCESS [0.972s]

[INFO] HBase - Examples .................................. SUCCESS [1.032s]

[INFO] HBase - Assembly .................................. SUCCESS [22.081s]

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Total time: 7:57.644s

[INFO] Finished at: Sun Apr 20 15:54:50 UTC 2014

[INFO] Final Memory: 127M/974M

Cos:
Do you get the same result ?
Ted, mine is failing on Thrift module. Are you building with cleaned ~/.m2 and ~/.ivy2 ? Cause that's what I am doing.

I cleared out ~/.m2/repository/org/apache
But I wasn't able to reproduce what you observed.

Hitting this everytime. Now right on the top-level module:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-site-plugin:3.3:site (default-site) on project hbase: failed to get report for org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-javadoc-plugin: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-antrun-plugin:1.6:run (generate) on project hbase-thrift: An Ant BuildException has occured: taskdef class org.apache.jasper.JspC cannot be found

Here's the command line used by Bigtop:

mvn -DskipTests -Dhadoop.profile=23 -Dslf4j.version=1.6.1 -Dhadoop.version=2.3.0 -Dzookeeper.version=3.4.5 -Phadoop-2.0 clean install  site assembly:assembly

Shall it be changed somehow?
With the command line above, I hit the same error.

Don't use '-Dhadoop.profile=23'

Use '-Dhadoop.profile=2.0'

Are you building from a release tarball Konstantin Boudnik?

Yes, using release tarball in the old-fashioned Bigtop way. BTW, are you saying that the build arguments got changed between 0.94 (what we've built in 0.7.0) and now and I have to update the bigtop build?
Andrew Purtell, I've tried using -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 and see the same effect. I think the backport is warranted.

Thanks. Konstantin Boudnik. +1 on the backport.

Separately I need to find out why this doesn't show up on the box I use to build releases.

As a side note: with the patch in place, the resolution comes all the way trough. However, the Thrift compilation fails with 

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:2.5.1:testCompile (default-testCompile) on project hbase-thrift: Compilation failure: Compilation failure:

[ERROR] /home/cos/work/bigtop/build/hbase/rpm/BUILD/hbase-0.98.1/hbase-thrift/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/TestThriftHBaseServiceHandlerWithLabels.java:[37,30] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol  : class HBaseTestingUtility   

[ERROR] location: package org.apache.hadoop.hbase

[ERROR] /home/cos/work/bigtop/build/hbase/rpm/BUILD/hbase-0.98.1/hbase-thrift/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/TestThriftHBaseServiceHandlerWithLabels.java:[40,30] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol  : class MediumTests

[ERROR] location: package org.apache.hadoop.hbase

and so on. Looks familiar? Shall I open another ticket for it?

Thanks for the verification, Cos.

I have integrated this to 0.98
Any comments on the compilation error above?

Here is the command I am running:

mvn -DskipTests -Dslf4j.version=1.6.1 -Dzookeeper.version=3.4.5 clean install site assembly:assembly

In 0.98, hadoop-2 is the default profile. So I didn't specify it on the command line.
With the above command, build passed using tip of 0.98 branch.

Yeah, looks like you're right.
So, it seems that combination of -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 -Phadoop-2.0 screws up the build process. Perhaps, this is something we need to track separately?

on the other note: thanks for your help guys!

'-Dhadoop.profile=XX' should be good (without -P).
'-Dhadoop.profile=2.0' doesn't work since hadoop-2 is the default profile - due to some maven magic.
What Ted said Cos. Easy to not define hadoop.profile in branches with a BOM that specifies 0.98+

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #272 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/272/)
HBASE-11023 Port HBASE-10488 "'mvn site' is broken due to org.apache.jasper.JspC not found" to 0.98 (tedyu: rev 1589271)

  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-server/pom.xml
  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-thrift/pom.xml

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #288 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/288/)
HBASE-11023 Port HBASE-10488 "'mvn site' is broken due to org.apache.jasper.JspC not found" to 0.98 (tedyu: rev 1589271)

  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-server/pom.xml
  • /hbase/branches/0.98/hbase-thrift/pom.xml

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
